meanings.definition: To secure a boat or ship in place with ropes or anchors.
meanings.sent1: The sailors moored the boat to the dock with strong ropes.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen always moored their small boat near the shore.
meanings.sent3: The talking parrot joked that it could moor the ship better than the captain.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him moored her heart to his, never to drift away.
meanings.sent5: The image of the boat moored under the starry sky stayed with him forever.

meanings.sent1: The moored ship gently rocked in the calm waters of the harbor.
meanings.sent2: The moored buoy marked the safe area for swimming in the lake.
meanings.sent3: The moored swing set in the park was always occupied by children laughing.
meanings.sent4: His eyes were drawn to the moored hot air balloon, a colorful dot against the blue sky.
meanings.sent5: The moored lighthouse stood tall, guiding ships safely through the night.
